country.question: Which country do you live in?

region.question: What is your administrative region?
region.notes: Country-specific region codes. First digit(s) indicate country code (3=South Korea, 5=Mongolia, 6=Philippines, 7=Taiwan, 8=Thailand, 9=Indonesia, 11=Vietnam, 12=Cambodia, 15=Australia).

level.question: Do you live in a rural or urban area?

SE3.question: What is your year of birth?
SE3.notes: Removed interviewer instructions. Year of birth recorded and converted to actual age. Lower limit is voting age, no upper limit.

SE3_1.question: What is your actual age?
SE3_1.notes: Computed from respondent's reported year of birth in SE3; interviewer calculated age.

values.5: Separated, married but separated, or not living with legal spouse

SE5.question: What is your highest level of education?

values.04: Incomplete secondary or high school: technical or vocational type
values.05: Complete secondary or high school: technical or vocational type

SE5a.question: How many years of formal education have you received?
SE5a.notes: Exclude kindergarten. Recorded as two-digit code.

SE6.question: What is your religion?
SE6.notes: Country-specific grid. Teams can devise more refined two-digit codes for specific denominations or country-specific religions under the generic decimal code.

SE8a.question: How many people live in your household?
SE8a.notes: Exact count. Include servants, transients, and boarders.

SE8b.question: How many generations of family members live in this household?

SE9.question: Are you currently employed?
SE9.notes: Removed interviewer instructions. If employed, continue to SE9a. If not employed, go to SE9d.

SE9a.question: Are you currently self-employed, working in a family business, or working for an outside employer?
SE9a.notes: If answer is 1 or 2, continue to SE9b. If 3 or 4, go to SE9c.

SE9b.question: How many people does your business employ?

SE9c.question: Which type of job do you have now?

SE10.question: Are you the main earner in your household?
SE10.notes: If yes, go to SE11. If no, continue to SE10_1.

SE10_1.question: Is the main earner in your household currently employed?
SE10_1.notes: If employed, continue to SE10a. If not employed, go to SE10d.

SE10a.question: Is the main earner in your household currently self-employed, working in a family business, or working for an outside employer?
SE10a.notes: If answer is 1 or 2, continue to SE10b. If 3 or 4, go to SE10c.

SE10b.question: How many people does the main earner's business employ?

SE10c.question: Which type of job does the main earner in your household have now?

SE10d.question: Is the main earner in your household currently seeking employment?

SE10e.question: What is the your household's main earner's current status?

SE11.question: What language do you speak the most in the home?

values.3: A mixture of local and official language

SE11a.question: What is your racial or ethnic background?

values.703: Mainland Chinese from various provinces and cities
values.1501: Aboriginal and / or Torres Strait Islander

SE11a.notes: Country-specific response categories. If respondent is born to a mixed family, record father's side.

SE14.question: What is your household income group?
SE14.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions. Values based on how the interviewer coded the response. Country teams required to use quintiles based on official household income statistics. If exact figures collected, convert to quintiles.

SE15a.question: Do you or your family own a vehicle (car, jeep, or van)?
SE15a.notes: Remove interviewer instructions. If answered 1, move to SE15a_1, else move to SE15b

SE15a_1.question: How many vehicles do you or your family own?

SE15b.question: Do you or your family own a tractor?

SE15c.question: Do you or your family own a television?

SE15d.question: Do you or your family own cable television?

SE15e.question: Do you or your family own a scooter, motorcycle, or moped?

SE15f.question: Do you or your family own a telephone?

SE15g.question: Do you or your family own a mobile telephone?

SE15h.question: Do you or your family own an electric fan or cooler?

SE15i.question: Do you or your family own a bicycle?

SE15j.question: Do you or your family own a radio or transistor?

SE15k.question: Do you or your family own a pumping set?

SE15l.question: Do you or your family own a fridge?

SE15m.question: Do you or your family own a camera?

SE15n.question: Do you or your family own goats or sheep?
SE15n.notes: Optional question. If answered 1, move to SE15n_1, else move to SE15o

SE15n_1.question: How many goats and/or sheep do you or your family own?

SE15o.question: Do you or your family own cows and/or buffalo?
SE15o.notes: Optional question. If answered 1, move to SE15o_1, else move to SE15p

SE15o_1.question: How many cows and/or buffalo do you or your family own?

SE15p.question: Do you or your family have an internet connection at home?

SE15q.question: Do you or your family own a boat?
SE15q.notes: Optional question. If answered 1, move to SE15q_1, else finish.

SE15q_1.question: How many boats do you or your family own?

Q1.question: How would you rate the country's current economic condition?

Q3.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q4.question: How would you rate your family's current economic situation?
Q4.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions. Rephrased 'So so (not good nor bad)' to 'Neither good nor bad' for clarity.

Q5.question: How does your family's current economic condition compare to what it was a few years ago?
Q5.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q6.question: How do you think your family's economic situation will be a few years from now?
Q6.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q80.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'Over the long run, our system of government is capable of solving the problems our country faces'?
Q80.notes: Remove interviewer instructions. Questions Q80-Q83 ask about the regime or system in general, not current leaders.

Q81.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'I am proud of our system of government'?
Q81.notes: Remove interviewer instructions. Questions Q80-Q83 ask about the regime or system in general, not current leaders.

Q82.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'A system like ours deserves the people's support even if it runs into problems'?
Q82.notes: Remove interviewer instructions. Questions Q80-Q83 ask about the regime or system in general, not current leaders.

Q83.question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'I would rather live under our system of government than any other that I can think of'?
Q83.notes: Remove interviewer instructions. Questions Q80-Q83 ask about the regime or system in general, not current leaders.

Q84.question: Compared with other systems in the world, would you say our system of government works fine as it is, needs minor change, needs major change, or should be replaced?

values.1: It works fine, does not need to change

Q85.question: Which one of the following do you think is an essential characteristic of a democracy: (1) Government narrows the gap between the rich and the poor, (2) People choose the government leaders in free and fair elections, (3) Government does not waste any public money, or (4) People are free to express their political views openly?

values.1: Government narrows the gap between the rich and the poor
values.2: People choose the government leaders in free and fair election
values.3: Government does not waste any public money
values.4: People are free to express their political views openly

Q85.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q86.question: Which one of the following do you think is an essential characteristic of a democracy: (1) The legislature has oversight over the government, (2) Basic necessities like food, clothes, and shelter are provided for all, (3) People are free to organize political groups, or (4) Government provides people with quality public services?

values.1: The legislature has oversight over the government
values.2: Basic necessities, like food, clothes and shelter, are provided for all
values.3: People are free to organize political groups
values.4: Government provides people with quality public services

Q86.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q87.question: Which one of the following do you think is an essential characteristic of a democracy: (1) Government ensures law and order, (2) Media is free to criticize the things government does, (3) Government ensures job opportunities for all, or (4) Multiple parties compete fairly in elections?

values.2: Media is free to criticize the things government does
values.3: Government ensures job opportunities for all
values.4: Multiple parties compete fairly in the election

Q87.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q88.question: Which one of the following do you think is an essential characteristic of a democracy: (1) People have the freedom to take part in protests and demonstrations, (2) Politics is clean and free of corruption, (3) The court protects ordinary people from the abuse of government power, or (4) People receive state aid if they are unemployed?

values.1: People have the freedom to take part in protests and demonstrations
values.2: Politics is clean and free of corruption
values.3: The court protects the ordinary people from the abuse of government power
values.4: People receive state aid if they are unemployed

Q88.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions.

Q90.question: On the whole, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with the way democracy works in your country?
Q90.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions. Replaced country name placeholder with your country.

Q91.question: In your opinion, how much of a democracy is your country?

values.2: A democracy, but with minor problems

Q91.notes: Removed survey artifacts. Removed interviewer instructions. Replaced country name placeholder with your country.

Q92.question: On a scale from 1 (completely undemocratic) to 10 (completely democratic), where would you place our country under the present government?

Q93.notes: Original scale only had value labels on 1 and 10. Added value labels to all numbers as per instructions

Q94.notes: Original scale only had value labels on 1 and 10. Added value labels to all numbers as per instructions

Q95.notes: Original scale only had value labels on 1 and 10. Added value labels to all numbers as per instructions

Q124.question: Which of the following statements comes closest to your own opinion?

values.1: Democracy is always preferable to any other kind of government
values.2: Under some circumstances, an authoritarian government can be preferable to a democratic one
values.3: For people like me, it does not matter whether we have a democratic or a nondemocratic regime

Q124.notes: Removed interviwer instructions. Removed survey artifacts.

Q125.question: Which of the following statements comes closer to your own view?

values.1: Democracy is capable of solving the problems of our society
values.2: Democracy cannot solve our society's problems

Q125.notes: Removed interviwer instructions. Removed survey artifacts.

Q126.question: If you had to choose between democracy and economic development, which would you say is more important?

values.1: Economic development is definitely more important
values.2: Economic development is somewhat more important

Q126.notes: Removed interviwer instructions. Removed survey artifacts.

Q127.question: If you had to choose between reducing economic inequality and protecting political freedom, which would you say is more important?

values.1: Reducing economic inequality is definitely more important
values.2: Reducing economic inequality is somewhat more important
values.3: Protecting political freedom is somewhat more important
values.4: Protecting political freedom is definitely more important

Q127.notes: Removed interviwer instructions. Removed survey artifacts.

Q157.question: Which of the following statements do you agree with the most: Our country should limit the imports of foreign goods to protect our farmers and workers, or our country should do more trade with other countries even if the rise of imports might harm our workers and farmers?

values.1: Limit imports of foreign goods to protect farmers and workers
values.2: Trade more with other countries even if it might harm workers and farmers

Q157a.description: limit imports vs more trade - strength of agreement

Q172a.description: emergency powers justified - public health crisis
Q172a.question: Do you think it would be justified for the government to use emergency powers to constrain individual rights and freedoms during a public health crisis like the Covid-19 pandemic?
Q172a.notes: Emergency powers include imposing curfew or censorship on social media.

Q172b.question: Do you think it would be justified for the government to use emergency powers to constrain individual rights and freedoms during an economic crisis that has caused the loss of many jobs?
Q172b.notes: Emergency powers include imposing curfew or censorship on social media.

Q172c.question: Do you think it would be justified for the government to use emergency powers to constrain individual rights and freedoms during widespread corruption that the president or PM claims can only be reduced by increasing executive power?
Q172c.notes: Emergency powers include imposing curfew or censorship on social media.

Q172d.question: Do you think it would be justified for the government to use emergency powers to constrain individual rights and freedoms during a security crisis due to social unrest or terrorism?
Q172d.notes: Emergency powers include imposing curfew or censorship on social media.

Q172e.question: Do you think it would be justified for the government to use emergency powers to constrain individual rights and freedoms when the country is at war?
Q172e.notes: Emergency powers include imposing curfew or censorship on social media.

Q139a.question: During the pandemic, did you or a member of your family suffer from serious illness or death?

Q142.question: How well or badly do you think the government handled the pandemic?

values.97: This is not the government's responsibility

Q143a.description: justifiable to postpone elections during health crisis
Q143a.question: When there is a public health challenge like the coronavirus, is it justifiable for the government to postpone elections?

Q143b.description: justifiable to limit freedoms during health crisis
Q143b.question: When there is a public health challenge like the coronavirus, is it justifiable for the government to limit freedom of speech or assembly?

Q143c.description: justifiable to censor media during health crisis
Q143c.question: When there is a public health challenge like the coronavirus, is it justifiable for the government to censor the media?

Q143d.description: justifiable to track citizens during health crisis
Q143d.question: When there is a public health challenge like the coronavirus, is it justifiable for the government to track citizens' locations at all times?

Q143e.description: justifiable to impose long lockdown during health crisis
Q143e.question: When there is a public health challenge like the coronavirus, is it justifiable for the government to impose a lockdown for a long time?

Q144.question: Have you been vaccinated against Covid-19?

values.2: No, but I will get vaccinated when it is available
values.3: No, but I will get vaccinated when I can get my preferred vaccine
values.4: No. My health condition doesn't allow me to get vaccinated
values.5: No. I prefer not to be vaccinated

Q144.notes: Removed interviewer instructions. Skip Q145 if respondent answers 1-4. Go to Q145 only if answer is 5.

Q145.question: Why do you prefer not to be vaccinated against Covid-19?

values.1: I'm worried about the side effects
values.2: I don't trust vaccines in general
values.3: I don't feel I need to be vaccinated
values.5: I don't trust the producer of the vaccine

Q145.notes: Removed interviewer instructions. Asked only if respondent prefers not to be vaccinated (Q144=5).
